meanings.definition: A hormone secreted by the pituitary gland that stimulates the thyroid gland to produce thyroid hormones.
meanings.sent1: The thyrotropin from the pituitary gland helps the thyroid gland make hormones.
meanings.sent2: Doctors check thyrotropin levels to see if the thyroid is working properly.
meanings.sent3: The thyrotropin threw a party in the thyroid gland to boost hormone production.
meanings.sent4: Like a conductor, thyrotropin directs the thyroid gland orchestra of hormones.
meanings.sent5: The role of thyrotropin is like a messenger delivering urgent messages to the thyroid gland.
